para: This option allows you to manually specify the GPS week rollover period for the track data.

The GPS system broadcasts time as a week number and the number of seconds into that week. The week number is a 10-bit value, which means it resets to zero every 1024 weeks (approximately every 19.6 years). This event is known as a "week number rollover".

If this option is not specified, or is set to -1, GPSBabel will use its "best guess" to determine the correct 1024-week epoch, assuming the data was recorded in the most recent period. This is almost always correct for modern data.

You should only need to use this option if you are working with very old data that crosses a rollover boundary. The epochs are:
0: Jan 6, 1980 - Aug 21, 1999
1: Aug 22, 1999 - Apr 6, 2019
2: Apr 7, 2019 - Nov 20, 2038
